lexUnit.name: relaxed.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: feeling little tension or anxiety; calm and comfortable

sentence.text: She was n't usually like this , she usually had a fairly relaxed attitude towards life .
They had gone from fairly relaxed enemies , who could at least eat together , to this state of nerve-breaking tension .
A ` desperate " candidate stands much less chance than a more relaxed candidate who goes into the interview knowing that she/he has other options .
Dalglish , a much more relaxed man these days , seemed conscious of his old po-faced Anfield image when he claimed to possess as much feeling as the next man .
After a stay at Cedar Falls , you 'll feel totally relaxed and invigorated and ready for anything !
You will feel very relaxed and comfortable .
Quite startled , he roared with laughter , his face very relaxed and happy .

Hypnotists now often suggest that the subject focuses his attention by staring fixedly at a drawing pin on the wall , while telling him in rather monotonous tones that he is becoming more relaxed and sleepy .
` So far as working with composers is concerned , providing you do not alienate them , they become more relaxed and their advice is more balanced because there is no hierarchy .
Their mood became relaxed , even though it was a hot night and they of course in dinner jackets .
To this point Beryl 's manner had been almost peremptory , now she became more relaxed and confiding .
He seemed relaxed and simple .
It was too public to kiss her when they danced ; she seemed more relaxed dancing with Nigel or Henry than with himself or Hubert .
He seemed so relaxed and gave no hint that anything was wrong . "
He seemed relaxed , too , as he turned to the beaming waitress and ordered water and a carafe of wine .
Anyone who is not relaxed and glowing with a sense of well-being at the wheel of a good Stag should keep their money in the building society .
The atmosphere of the Club was one of happy , relaxed holidaymakers and friendly staff who immediately made us feel completely at home .
The teacher must ensure that the student is relaxed , so that stress does not interfere with learning .
They have developed the ability to stand stock-still , like statues , until the fish are relaxed and unwary .
True , he was quite relaxed and , as always , full of bonhomie , but somehow he seemed to be looking with far greater intensity towards the past than the present .
Collingridge was clearly in a relaxed and very trusting mood .
Bangor now that they are safe , will be in a relaxed mood and are sure to make things very tough for North at Ormeau on Sunday .
Norman also pictured the almost unbelievable sumptuousness of the luxury steamboat liners , with their relaxed passengers at cards or dinner , a waiter for every passenger .
Andrew gives a relaxed , reflective smile .
Cameron raised his right hand , clenched his fist , and spoke in a relaxed voice .
A simple family record should be equally simple in its choice of words and spoken in a natural and relaxed tone of voice .
It is important that the dam is kept as quiet a possible -- a relaxed mother has contented pups .
They both looked relaxed , an easy familiarity between them now that they were away from the office and cut free from the restrictions of boss and secretary .
Looking relaxed , Jamie Blandford reclined on Channel Four 's Big Breakfast studio bed , with his interviewer , Paula Yates and opened up about his controversial life .
